page.title: 15The Putnoe Area
page.content: Some of the main features in this area are Mowsbury Park and the golf course.Mowsbury Park covers about 5 acres and has been kept well.It has tennis courts,bowling greens,football and cricket pitches.The majority of the park is grassland with Putnoe Woods next to it.This has not been kept very well but it does have a large variety of plant and animal life.On the north edge of the woods is a stream that separates it from the golf course.The main school which serves this area is Mark Rutherford Upper School.This currently has about 850 pupils and 52 teaching staff.Since there are fewer children living in the area the main concern at the moment is the proposed merger of Mark Rutherford and Pilgrim Upper schools.
